message_1: Find the number of all possible functions from a set A with 4 elements to a set B with 3 elements according to the type theory.
message_2:
In type theory, a function from a set A with 4 elements to a set B with 3 elements can be represented as a mapping from each element in A to an element in B. Since there are 3 elements in B, each element in A can be mapped to any of the 3 elements in B.

To find the total number of possible functions, we can use the formula:

(number of elements in B)^(number of elements in A)

In this case, we have:

3^4 = 81

So there are 81 possible functions from a set A with 4 elements to a set B with 3 elements according to type theory.
